00050 /* Consistency check, since restoring assumes similar bitpositions in */
00051 /* CMU OSCENCMD and STATUS regs */
00052 #if (CMU_STATUS_AUXHFRCOENS != CMU_OSCENCMD_AUXHFRCOEN)
00053 #error Conflict in AUXHFRCOENS and AUXHFRCOEN bitpositions
00054 #endif
00055 #if (CMU_STATUS_HFXOENS != CMU_OSCENCMD_HFXOEN)
00056 #error Conflict in HFXOENS and HFXOEN bitpositions
00057 #endif
00058 #if (CMU_STATUS_LFRCOENS != CMU_OSCENCMD_LFRCOEN)
00059 #error Conflict in LFRCOENS and LFRCOEN bitpositions
00060 #endif
00061 #if (CMU_STATUS_LFXOENS != CMU_OSCENCMD_LFXOEN)
00062 #error Conflict in LFXOENS and LFXOEN bitpositions
00063 #endif

00067 /* Fix for errata EMU_E107 - non-WIC interrupt masks. */
00068 #if defined( _EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY )
00069 #define ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN
00070 #define NON_WIC_INT_MASK_0    (~(0x0dfc0323U))
00071 #define NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1    (~(0x0U))
00072 
00073 #elif defined( _EFM32_TINY_FAMILY )
00074 #define ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN
00075 #define NON_WIC_INT_MASK_0    (~(0x001be323U))
00076 #define NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1    (~(0x0U))
00077 
00078 #elif defined( _EFM32_GIANT_FAMILY )
00079 #define ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN
00080 #define NON_WIC_INT_MASK_0    (~(0xff020e63U))
00081 #define NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1    (~(0x00000046U))
00082 
00083 #elif defined( _EFM32_WONDER_FAMILY )
00084 #define ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN
00085 #define NON_WIC_INT_MASK_0    (~(0xff020e63U))
00086 #define NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1    (~(0x00000046U))
00087 
00088 #else
00089 /* Zero Gecko and future families are not affected by errata EMU_E107 */
00090 #endif
00091 
00092 /* Fix for errata EMU_E108 - High Current Consumption on EM4 Entry. */
00093 #if defined( _EFM32_HAPPY_FAMILY )
00094 #define ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E108_EN
00095 #endif

00099  **************************   LOCAL VARIABLES   ********************************

00112 static uint32_t cmuStatus;
00113 #if defined( _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_RESETVALUE )
00114 static uint16_t cmuHfclkStatus;
00115 #endif

00119 /*******************************************************************************
00120  **************************   LOCAL FUNCTIONS   ********************************
00121  ******************************************************************************/
00122 
00125 /***************************************************************************/
00129 static void emuRestore(void)
00130 {
00131   uint32_t oscEnCmd;
00132   uint32_t cmuLocked;
00133 
00134   /* Although we could use the CMU API for most of the below handling, we */
00135   /* would like this function to be as efficient as possible. */
00136 
00137   /* CMU registers may be locked */
00138   cmuLocked = CMU->LOCK & CMU_LOCK_LOCKKEY_LOCKED;
00139   CMU_Unlock();
00140 
00141   /* AUXHFRCO are automatically disabled (except if using debugger). */
00142   /* HFRCO, USHFRCO and HFXO are automatically disabled. */
00143   /* LFRCO/LFXO may be disabled by SW in EM3. */
00144   /* Restore according to status prior to entering energy mode. */
00145   oscEnCmd = 0;
00146   oscEnCmd |= ((cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_HFRCOENS)    ? CMU_OSCENCMD_HFRCOEN : 0);
00147   oscEnCmd |= ((cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_AUXHFRCOENS) ? CMU_OSCENCMD_AUXHFRCOEN : 0);
00148   oscEnCmd |= ((cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_LFRCOENS)    ? CMU_OSCENCMD_LFRCOEN : 0);
00149   oscEnCmd |= ((cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_HFXOENS)     ? CMU_OSCENCMD_HFXOEN : 0);
00150   oscEnCmd |= ((cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_LFXOENS)     ? CMU_OSCENCMD_LFXOEN : 0);
00151 #if defined( _CMU_STATUS_USHFRCOENS_MASK )
00152   oscEnCmd |= ((cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_USHFRCOENS)  ? CMU_OSCENCMD_USHFRCOEN : 0);
00153 #endif
00154   CMU->OSCENCMD = oscEnCmd;
00155 
00156 
00157   /* Restore oscillator used for clocking core */
00158 #if defined( _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_RESETVALUE )
00159   switch (cmuHfclkStatus & _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_MASK)
00160   {
00161     case CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_LFRCO:
00162       /* HFRCO could only be selected if the autostart HFXO feature is not
00163        * enabled, otherwise the HFXO would be started and selected automatically.
00164        * Note: this error hook helps catching erroneous oscillator configurations,
00165        * when the AUTOSTARTSELEM0EM1 is set in CMU_HFXOCTRL. */
00166       if (!(CMU->HFXOCTRL & CMU_HFXOCTRL_AUTOSTARTSELEM0EM1))
00167       {
00168         /* Wait for LFRCO to stabilize */
00169         while (!(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFRCORDY))
00170           ;
00171         CMU->HFCLKSEL = CMU_HFCLKSEL_HF_LFRCO;
00172       }
00173       else
00174       {
00175         EFM_ASSERT(0);
00176       }
00177       break;
00178 
00179     case CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_LFXO:
00180       /* Wait for LFXO to stabilize */
00181       while (!(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFXORDY))
00182         ;
00183       CMU->HFCLKSEL = CMU_HFCLKSEL_HF_LFXO;
00184       break;
00185 
00186     case CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_HFXO:
00187       /* Wait for HFXO to stabilize */
00188       while (!(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_HFXORDY))
00189         ;
00190       CMU->HFCLKSEL = CMU_HFCLKSEL_HF_HFXO;
00191       break;
00192 
00193     default: /* CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_HFRCO */
00194       /* If core clock was HFRCO core clock, it is automatically restored to */
00195       /* state prior to entering energy mode. No need for further action. */
00196       break;
00197   }
00198 #else
00199   switch (cmuStatus & (CMU_STATUS_HFRCOSEL
00200                       | CMU_STATUS_HFXOSEL
00201                       | CMU_STATUS_LFRCOSEL
00202 #if defined( CMU_STATUS_USHFRCODIV2SEL )
00203                       | CMU_STATUS_USHFRCODIV2SEL
00204 #endif
00205                       | CMU_STATUS_LFXOSEL))
00206   {
00207     case CMU_STATUS_LFRCOSEL:
00208       /* Wait for LFRCO to stabilize */
00209       while (!(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFRCORDY))
00210         ;
00211       CMU->CMD = CMU_CMD_HFCLKSEL_LFRCO;
00212       break;
00213 
00214     case CMU_STATUS_LFXOSEL:
00215       /* Wait for LFXO to stabilize */
00216       while (!(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_LFXORDY))
00217         ;
00218       CMU->CMD = CMU_CMD_HFCLKSEL_LFXO;
00219       break;
00220 
00221     case CMU_STATUS_HFXOSEL:
00222       /* Wait for HFXO to stabilize */
00223       while (!(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_HFXORDY))
00224         ;
00225       CMU->CMD = CMU_CMD_HFCLKSEL_HFXO;
00226       break;
00227 
00228 #if defined( CMU_STATUS_USHFRCODIV2SEL )
00229     case CMU_STATUS_USHFRCODIV2SEL:
00230       /* Wait for USHFRCO to stabilize */
00231       while (!(CMU->STATUS & CMU_STATUS_USHFRCORDY))
00232         ;
00233       CMU->CMD = _CMU_CMD_HFCLKSEL_USHFRCODIV2;
00234       break;
00235 #endif
00236 
00237     default: /* CMU_STATUS_HFRCOSEL */
00238       /* If core clock was HFRCO core clock, it is automatically restored to */
00239       /* state prior to entering energy mode. No need for further action. */
00240       break;
00241   }
00242 
00243   /* If HFRCO was disabled before entering Energy Mode, turn it off again */
00244   /* as it is automatically enabled by wake up */
00245   if ( ! (cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_HFRCOENS) )
00246   {
00247     CMU->OSCENCMD = CMU_OSCENCMD_HFRCODIS;
00248   }
00249 #endif
00250   /* Restore CMU register locking */
00251   if (cmuLocked)
00252   {
00253     CMU_Lock();
00254   }
00255 }
00256 
00257 
00258 /* Get enable conditions for errata EMU_E107 fix. */
00259 #if defined( ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN )
00260 static __INLINE bool getErrataFixEmuE107En(void)
00261 {
00262   /* SYSTEM_ChipRevisionGet could have been used here, but we would like a
00263    * faster implementation in this case.
00264    */
00265   uint16_t majorMinorRev;
00266 
00267   /* CHIP MAJOR bit [3:0] */
00268   majorMinorRev = ((ROMTABLE->PID0 & _ROMTABLE_PID0_REVMAJOR_MASK)
00269                    >> _ROMTABLE_PID0_REVMAJOR_SHIFT)
00270                   << 8;
00271   /* CHIP MINOR bit [7:4] */
00272   majorMinorRev |= ((ROMTABLE->PID2 & _ROMTABLE_PID2_REVMINORMSB_MASK)
00273                     >> _ROMTABLE_PID2_REVMINORMSB_SHIFT)
00274                    << 4;
00275   /* CHIP MINOR bit [3:0] */
00276   majorMinorRev |= (ROMTABLE->PID3 & _ROMTABLE_PID3_REVMINORLSB_MASK)
00277                    >> _ROMTABLE_PID3_REVMINORLSB_SHIFT;
00278 
00279 #if defined( _EFM32_GECKO_FAMILY )
00280   return (majorMinorRev <= 0x0103);
00281 #elif defined( _EFM32_TINY_FAMILY )
00282   return (majorMinorRev <= 0x0102);
00283 #elif defined( _EFM32_GIANT_FAMILY )
00284   return (majorMinorRev <= 0x0103) || (majorMinorRev == 0x0204);
00285 #elif defined( _EFM32_WONDER_FAMILY )
00286   return (majorMinorRev == 0x0100);
00287 #else
00288   /* Zero Gecko and future families are not affected by errata EMU_E107 */
00289   return false;
00290 #endif
00291 }
00292 #endif

00298  **************************   GLOBAL FUNCTIONS   *******************************

00301 /***************************************************************************/
00347 void EMU_EnterEM2(bool restore)
00348 {
00349 #if defined( ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN )
00350   bool errataFixEmuE107En;
00351   uint32_t nonWicIntEn[2];
00352 #endif
00353 
00354   /* Auto-update CMU status just in case before entering energy mode. */
00355   /* This variable is normally kept up-to-date by the CMU API. */
00356   cmuStatus = CMU->STATUS;
00357 #if defined( _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_RESETVALUE )
00358   cmuHfclkStatus = (uint16_t)(CMU->HFCLKSTATUS);
00359 #endif
00360 
00361   /* Enter Cortex-M3 deep sleep mode */
00362   SCB->SCR |= SCB_SCR_SLEEPDEEP_Msk;
00363 
00364   /* Fix for errata EMU_E107 - store non-WIC interrupt enable flags.
00365      Disable the enabled non-WIC interrupts. */
00366 #if defined( ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN )
00367   errataFixEmuE107En = getErrataFixEmuE107En();
00368   if (errataFixEmuE107En)
00369   {
00370     nonWicIntEn[0] = NVIC->ISER[0] & NON_WIC_INT_MASK_0;
00371     NVIC->ICER[0] = nonWicIntEn[0];
00372 #if (NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1 != (~(0x0U)))
00373     nonWicIntEn[1] = NVIC->ISER[1] & NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1;
00374     NVIC->ICER[1] = nonWicIntEn[1];
00375 #endif
00376   }
00377 #endif
00378 
00379   __WFI();
00380 
00381   /* Fix for errata EMU_E107 - restore state of non-WIC interrupt enable flags. */
00382 #if defined( ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN )
00383   if (errataFixEmuE107En)
00384   {
00385     NVIC->ISER[0] = nonWicIntEn[0];
00386 #if (NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1 != (~(0x0U)))
00387     NVIC->ISER[1] = nonWicIntEn[1];
00388 #endif
00389   }
00390 #endif
00391 
00392   /* Restore oscillators/clocks if specified */
00393   if (restore)
00394   {
00395     emuRestore();
00396   }
00397   /* If not restoring, and original clock was not HFRCO, we have to */
00398   /* update CMSIS core clock variable since core clock has changed */
00399   /* to using HFRCO. */
00400 #if defined( _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_RESETVALUE )
00401   else if ((cmuHfclkStatus & _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_MASK)
00402            != CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_HFRCO)
00403 #else
00404   else if (!(cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_HFRCOSEL))
00405 #endif
00406   {
00407     SystemCoreClockUpdate();
00408   }
00409 }
00410

00412 /***************************************************************************/
00454 void EMU_EnterEM3(bool restore)
00455 {
00456   uint32_t cmuLocked;
00457 
00458 #if defined( ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN )
00459   bool errataFixEmuE107En;
00460   uint32_t nonWicIntEn[2];
00461 #endif
00462 
00463   /* Auto-update CMU status just in case before entering energy mode. */
00464   /* This variable is normally kept up-to-date by the CMU API. */
00465   cmuStatus = CMU->STATUS;
00466 #if defined( _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_RESETVALUE )
00467   cmuHfclkStatus = (uint16_t)(CMU->HFCLKSTATUS);
00468 #endif
00469 
00470   /* CMU registers may be locked */
00471   cmuLocked = CMU->LOCK & CMU_LOCK_LOCKKEY_LOCKED;
00472   CMU_Unlock();
00473 
00474   /* Disable LF oscillators */
00475   CMU->OSCENCMD = CMU_OSCENCMD_LFXODIS | CMU_OSCENCMD_LFRCODIS;
00476 
00477   /* Restore CMU register locking */
00478   if (cmuLocked)
00479   {
00480     CMU_Lock();
00481   }
00482 
00483   /* Enter Cortex-M3 deep sleep mode */
00484   SCB->SCR |= SCB_SCR_SLEEPDEEP_Msk;
00485 
00486   /* Fix for errata EMU_E107 - store non-WIC interrupt enable flags.
00487      Disable the enabled non-WIC interrupts. */
00488 #if defined( ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN )
00489   errataFixEmuE107En = getErrataFixEmuE107En();
00490   if (errataFixEmuE107En)
00491   {
00492     nonWicIntEn[0] = NVIC->ISER[0] & NON_WIC_INT_MASK_0;
00493     NVIC->ICER[0] = nonWicIntEn[0];
00494 #if (NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1 != (~(0x0U)))
00495     nonWicIntEn[1] = NVIC->ISER[1] & NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1;
00496     NVIC->ICER[1] = nonWicIntEn[1];
00497 #endif
00498 
00499   }
00500 #endif
00501 
00502   __WFI();
00503 
00504   /* Fix for errata EMU_E107 - restore state of non-WIC interrupt enable flags. */
00505 #if defined( ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E107_EN )
00506   if (errataFixEmuE107En)
00507   {
00508     NVIC->ISER[0] = nonWicIntEn[0];
00509 #if (NON_WIC_INT_MASK_1 != (~(0x0U)))
00510     NVIC->ISER[1] = nonWicIntEn[1];
00511 #endif
00512   }
00513 #endif
00514 
00515   /* Restore oscillators/clocks if specified */
00516   if (restore)
00517   {
00518     emuRestore();
00519   }
00520   /* If not restoring, and original clock was not HFRCO, we have to */
00521   /* update CMSIS core clock variable since core clock has changed */
00522   /* to using HFRCO. */
00523 #if defined( _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_RESETVALUE )
00524   else if ((cmuHfclkStatus & _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_MASK)
00525            != CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_HFRCO)
00526 #else
00527   else if (!(cmuStatus & CMU_STATUS_HFRCOSEL))
00528 #endif
00529   {
00530     SystemCoreClockUpdate();
00531   }
00532 }

00535 /***************************************************************************/
00542 void EMU_EnterEM4(void)
00543 {
00544   int i;
00545 
00546 #if defined( _EMU_EM4CTRL_EM4ENTRY_SHIFT )
00547   uint32_t em4seq2 = (EMU->EM4CTRL & ~_EMU_EM4CTRL_EM4ENTRY_MASK)
00548                      | (2 << _EMU_EM4CTRL_EM4ENTRY_SHIFT);
00549   uint32_t em4seq3 = (EMU->EM4CTRL & ~_EMU_EM4CTRL_EM4ENTRY_MASK)
00550                      | (3 << _EMU_EM4CTRL_EM4ENTRY_SHIFT);
00551 #else
00552   uint32_t em4seq2 = (EMU->CTRL & ~_EMU_CTRL_EM4CTRL_MASK)
00553                      | (2 << _EMU_CTRL_EM4CTRL_SHIFT);
00554   uint32_t em4seq3 = (EMU->CTRL & ~_EMU_CTRL_EM4CTRL_MASK)
00555                      | (3 << _EMU_CTRL_EM4CTRL_SHIFT);
00556 #endif
00557 
00558   /* Make sure register write lock is disabled */
00559   EMU_Unlock();
00560 
00561 #if defined( ERRATA_FIX_EMU_E108_EN )
00562   /* Fix for errata EMU_E108 - High Current Consumption on EM4 Entry. */
00563   __disable_irq();
00564   *(volatile uint32_t *)0x400C80E4 = 0;
00565 #endif
00566 
00567   for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00568   {
00569 #if defined( _EMU_EM4CTRL_EM4ENTRY_SHIFT )
00570     EMU->EM4CTRL = em4seq2;
00571     EMU->EM4CTRL = em4seq3;
00572   }
00573   EMU->EM4CTRL = em4seq2;
00574 #else
00575     EMU->CTRL = em4seq2;
00576     EMU->CTRL = em4seq3;
00577   }
00578   EMU->CTRL = em4seq2;
00579 #endif
00580 }
00581

00583 /***************************************************************************/
00598 void EMU_MemPwrDown(uint32_t blocks)
00599 {
00600 #if defined( _EMU_MEMCTRL_POWERDOWN_MASK )
00601   EFM_ASSERT(blocks <= (_EMU_MEMCTRL_POWERDOWN_MASK
00602                         >> _EMU_MEMCTRL_POWERDOWN_SHIFT));
00603   EMU->MEMCTRL = blocks;
00604 
00605 #elif defined( _EMU_MEMCTRL_RAMPOWERDOWN_MASK )       \
00606       && defined( _EMU_MEMCTRL_RAMHPOWERDOWN_MASK )   \
00607       && defined( _EMU_MEMCTRL_SEQRAMPOWERDOWN_MASK )
00608   EFM_ASSERT((blocks & (_EMU_MEMCTRL_RAMPOWERDOWN_MASK
00609                         | _EMU_MEMCTRL_RAMHPOWERDOWN_MASK
00610                         | _EMU_MEMCTRL_SEQRAMPOWERDOWN_MASK))
00611              == blocks);
00612   EMU->MEMCTRL = blocks;
00613 
00614 #elif defined( _EMU_MEMCTRL_RAMPOWERDOWN_MASK )
00615   EFM_ASSERT((blocks & _EMU_MEMCTRL_RAMPOWERDOWN_MASK) == blocks);
00616   EMU->MEMCTRL = blocks;
00617 
00618 #else
00619   (void)blocks;
00620 #endif
00621 }

00624 /***************************************************************************/
00643 void EMU_UpdateOscConfig(void)
00644 {
00645   /* Fetch current configuration */
00646   cmuStatus = CMU->STATUS;
00647 #if defined( _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_RESETVALUE )
00648   cmuHfclkStatus = (uint16_t)(CMU->HFCLKSTATUS);
00649 #endif
00650 }

00653 /***************************************************************************/
00660 void EMU_EM23Init(EMU_EM23Init_TypeDef *em23Init)
00661 {
00662 #if defined( _EMU_CTRL_EMVREG_MASK )
00663   EMU->CTRL = em23Init->em23Vreg ? (EMU->CTRL | EMU_CTRL_EMVREG)
00664                                  : (EMU->CTRL & ~EMU_CTRL_EMVREG);
00665 #elif defined( _EMU_CTRL_EM23VREG_MASK )
00666   EMU->CTRL = em23Init->em23Vreg ? (EMU->CTRL | EMU_CTRL_EM23VREG)
00667                                  : (EMU->CTRL & ~EMU_CTRL_EM23VREG);
00668 #else
00669   (void)em23Init;
00670 #endif
00671 }
00672 
00673 
00674 #if defined( _EMU_EM4CONF_MASK ) || defined( _EMU_EM4CTRL_MASK )
00675 /***************************************************************************/
00682 void EMU_EM4Init(EMU_EM4Init_TypeDef *em4Init)
00683 {
00684 #if defined( _EMU_EM4CONF_MASK )
00685   /* Init for platforms with EMU->EM4CONF register */
00686   uint32_t em4conf = EMU->EM4CONF;
00687 
00688   /* Clear fields that will be reconfigured */
00689   em4conf &= ~(_EMU_EM4CONF_LOCKCONF_MASK
00690                | _EMU_EM4CONF_OSC_MASK
00691                | _EMU_EM4CONF_BURTCWU_MASK
00692                | _EMU_EM4CONF_VREGEN_MASK);
00693 
00694   /* Configure new settings */
00695   em4conf |= (em4Init->lockConfig << _EMU_EM4CONF_LOCKCONF_SHIFT)
00696              | (em4Init->osc)
00697              | (em4Init->buRtcWakeup << _EMU_EM4CONF_BURTCWU_SHIFT)
00698              | (em4Init->vreg << _EMU_EM4CONF_VREGEN_SHIFT);
00699 
00700   /* Apply configuration. Note that lock can be set after this stage. */
00701   EMU->EM4CONF = em4conf;
00702 
00703 #elif defined( _EMU_EM4CTRL_MASK )
00704   /* Init for platforms with EMU->EM4CTRL register */
00705 
00706   uint32_t em4ctrl = EMU->EM4CTRL;
00707 
00708   em4ctrl &= ~(_EMU_EM4CTRL_RETAINLFXO_MASK
00709                | _EMU_EM4CTRL_RETAINLFRCO_MASK
00710                | _EMU_EM4CTRL_RETAINULFRCO_MASK
00711                | _EMU_EM4CTRL_EM4STATE_MASK);
00712 
00713      em4ctrl |= (em4Init->retainLfxo     ? EMU_EM4CTRL_RETAINLFXO : 0)
00714                 | (em4Init->retainLfrco  ? EMU_EM4CTRL_RETAINLFRCO : 0)
00715                 | (em4Init->retainUlfrco ? EMU_EM4CTRL_RETAINULFRCO : 0)
00716                 | (em4Init->em4State     ? EMU_EM4CTRL_EM4STATE_EM4H : 0);
00717 
00718   EMU->EM4CTRL = em4ctrl;
00719 #endif
00720 }
00721 #endif
00722 
00723 
00724 #if defined( BU_PRESENT )
00725 /***************************************************************************/
00732 void EMU_BUPDInit(EMU_BUPDInit_TypeDef *bupdInit)
00733 {
00734   uint32_t reg;
00735 
00736   /* Set power connection configuration */
00737   reg = EMU->PWRCONF & ~(_EMU_PWRCONF_PWRRES_MASK
00738                          | _EMU_PWRCONF_VOUTSTRONG_MASK
00739                          | _EMU_PWRCONF_VOUTMED_MASK
00740                          | _EMU_PWRCONF_VOUTWEAK_MASK);
00741 
00742   reg |= bupdInit->resistor
00743          | (bupdInit->voutStrong << _EMU_PWRCONF_VOUTSTRONG_SHIFT)
00744          | (bupdInit->voutMed    << _EMU_PWRCONF_VOUTMED_SHIFT)
00745          | (bupdInit->voutWeak   << _EMU_PWRCONF_VOUTWEAK_SHIFT);
00746 
00747   EMU->PWRCONF = reg;
00748 
00749   /* Set backup domain inactive mode configuration */
00750   reg = EMU->BUINACT & ~(_EMU_BUINACT_PWRCON_MASK);
00751   reg |= (bupdInit->inactivePower);
00752   EMU->BUINACT = reg;
00753 
00754   /* Set backup domain active mode configuration */
00755   reg = EMU->BUACT & ~(_EMU_BUACT_PWRCON_MASK);
00756   reg |= (bupdInit->activePower);
00757   EMU->BUACT = reg;
00758 
00759   /* Set power control configuration */
00760   reg = EMU->BUCTRL & ~(_EMU_BUCTRL_PROBE_MASK
00761                         | _EMU_BUCTRL_BODCAL_MASK
00762                         | _EMU_BUCTRL_STATEN_MASK
00763                         | _EMU_BUCTRL_EN_MASK);
00764 
00765   /* Note use of ->enable to both enable BUPD, use BU_VIN pin input and
00766      release reset */
00767   reg |= bupdInit->probe
00768          | (bupdInit->bodCal          << _EMU_BUCTRL_BODCAL_SHIFT)
00769          | (bupdInit->statusPinEnable << _EMU_BUCTRL_STATEN_SHIFT)
00770          | (bupdInit->enable          << _EMU_BUCTRL_EN_SHIFT);
00771 
00772   /* Enable configuration */
00773   EMU->BUCTRL = reg;
00774 
00775   /* If enable is true, enable BU_VIN input power pin, if not disable it  */
00776   EMU_BUPinEnable(bupdInit->enable);
00777 
00778   /* If enable is true, release BU reset, if not keep reset asserted */
00779   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(RMU->CTRL), _RMU_CTRL_BURSTEN_SHIFT, !bupdInit->enable);
00780 }
00781 
00782 
00783 /***************************************************************************/
00791 void EMU_BUThresholdSet(EMU_BODMode_TypeDef mode, uint32_t value)
00792 {
00793   EFM_ASSERT(value<8);
00794   EFM_ASSERT(value<=(_EMU_BUACT_BUEXTHRES_MASK>>_EMU_BUACT_BUEXTHRES_SHIFT));
00795 
00796   switch(mode)
00797   {
00798     case emuBODMode_Active:
00799       EMU->BUACT = (EMU->BUACT & ~_EMU_BUACT_BUEXTHRES_MASK)
00800                    | (value<<_EMU_BUACT_BUEXTHRES_SHIFT);
00801       break;
00802     case emuBODMode_Inactive:
00803       EMU->BUINACT = (EMU->BUINACT & ~_EMU_BUINACT_BUENTHRES_MASK)
00804                      | (value<<_EMU_BUINACT_BUENTHRES_SHIFT);
00805       break;
00806   }
00807 }
00808 
00809 
00810 /***************************************************************************/
00818 void EMU_BUThresRangeSet(EMU_BODMode_TypeDef mode, uint32_t value)
00819 {
00820   EFM_ASSERT(value < 4);
00821   EFM_ASSERT(value<=(_EMU_BUACT_BUEXRANGE_MASK>>_EMU_BUACT_BUEXRANGE_SHIFT));
00822 
00823   switch(mode)
00824   {
00825     case emuBODMode_Active:
00826       EMU->BUACT = (EMU->BUACT & ~_EMU_BUACT_BUEXRANGE_MASK)
00827                    | (value<<_EMU_BUACT_BUEXRANGE_SHIFT);
00828       break;
00829     case emuBODMode_Inactive:
00830       EMU->BUINACT = (EMU->BUINACT & ~_EMU_BUINACT_BUENRANGE_MASK)
00831                      | (value<<_EMU_BUINACT_BUENRANGE_SHIFT);
00832       break;
00833   }
00834 }
00835 #endif
00836 
00837 #if defined( _EMU_DCDCCTRL_MASK )
00838 /***************************************************************************/
00845 void EMU_DCDCModeSet(EMU_DcdcMode_TypeDef dcdcMode)
00846 {
00847   EMU->DCDCCTRL = (EMU->DCDCCTRL & ~_EMU_DCDCCTRL_DCDCMODE_MASK) | dcdcMode;
00848 }

00850 
00851 /***************************************************************************/
00858 static bool EMU_DCDCCalibrationLoad(void)
00859 {
00860 #if defined( _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_3V0LNATT1_MASK )
00861   uint32_t val;
00862   volatile uint32_t *reg;
00863 
00864   /* DI calib data in flash */
00865   volatile uint32_t* const diCal_EMU_DCDCLNFREQCTRL =  (volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE08038);
00866   volatile uint32_t* const diCal_EMU_DCDCLNVCTRL =     (volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE08040);
00867   volatile uint32_t* const diCal_EMU_DCDCLPCTRL =      (volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE08048);
00868   volatile uint32_t* const diCal_EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL =     (volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE08050);
00869   volatile uint32_t* const diCal_EMU_DCDCTRIM0 =       (volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE08058);
00870   volatile uint32_t* const diCal_EMU_DCDCTRIM1 =       (volatile uint32_t *)(0x0FE08060);
00871 
00872   val = EMU->PWRCFG & _EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_MASK;
00873   if ((val == EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_STARTUP) || (val == EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_NODCDC))
00874   {
00875     return false;
00876   }
00877 
00878   if (DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL0 != 0xFFFFFFFF)
00879   {
00880     val = *(diCal_EMU_DCDCLNFREQCTRL + 1);
00881     reg = (volatile uint32_t *)*diCal_EMU_DCDCLNFREQCTRL;
00882     *reg = val;
00883 
00884     val = *(diCal_EMU_DCDCLNVCTRL + 1);
00885     reg = (volatile uint32_t *)*diCal_EMU_DCDCLNVCTRL;
00886     *reg = val;
00887 
00888     val = *(diCal_EMU_DCDCLPCTRL + 1);
00889     reg = (volatile uint32_t *)*diCal_EMU_DCDCLPCTRL;
00890     *reg = val;
00891 
00892     val = *(diCal_EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL + 1);
00893     reg = (volatile uint32_t *)*diCal_EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL;
00894     *reg = val;
00895 
00896     val = *(diCal_EMU_DCDCTRIM0 + 1);
00897     reg = (volatile uint32_t *)*diCal_EMU_DCDCTRIM0;
00898     *reg = val;
00899 
00900     val = *(diCal_EMU_DCDCTRIM1 + 1);
00901     reg = (volatile uint32_t *)*diCal_EMU_DCDCTRIM1;
00902     *reg = val;
00903 
00904     return true;
00905   }
00906   return false;
00907 #else
00908   /* Return true if DEVINFO calibration data is undefined by CMSIS */
00909   return true;
00910 #endif
00911 }
00912 
00913 
00914 /***************************************************************************/
00924 bool EMU_DCDCInit(EMU_DCDCInit_TypeDef *dcdcInit)
00925 {
00926   /* Set external power configuration. This enables writing to the other
00927      DCDC registers. */
00928   EMU->PWRCFG = (EMU->PWRCFG & ~_EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_MASK) | dcdcInit->powerConfig;
00929 
00930   /* EMU->PWRCFG is write-once and POR/pin reset only. Check that
00931      we could set the desired power configuration. */
00932   if ((EMU->PWRCFG & _EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_MASK) != dcdcInit->powerConfig)
00933   {
00934     return false;
00935   }
00936 
00937   /* Load calibration data from DI page into DCDC */
00938   if (!EMU_DCDCCalibrationLoad())
00939   {
00940     return false;
00941   }
00942 
00943   /* Set DCDC low-power mode comparator bias selection */
00944   BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&EMU->DCDCMISCCTRL, _EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_MASK, dcdcInit->lpcmpBias);
00945 
00946   /* Set DCDC output voltage */
00947   if (!EMU_DCDCOutputVoltageSet(dcdcInit->mVout))
00948   {
00949     return false;
00950   }
00951 
00952   /* Set EM2 - 4 DCDC operating mode. If false, then
00953      dcdcInit->dcdcMode is applied in EM2-4. */
00954   BUS_RegBitWrite(&EMU->DCDCCTRL, _EMU_DCDCCTRL_DCDCMODEEM23_SHIFT, dcdcInit->em23LowPower);
00955   BUS_RegBitWrite(&EMU->DCDCCTRL, _EMU_DCDCCTRL_DCDCMODEEM4_SHIFT, dcdcInit->em4LowPower);
00956 
00957   /* Set EM0 DCDC operating mode. Output voltage set in EMU_DCDCOutputVoltageSet()
00958      above takes effect when mode is changed from bypass here. */
00959   EMU_DCDCModeSet(dcdcInit->dcdcMode);
00960 
00961   return true;
00962 }
00963 
00964 
00965 /***************************************************************************/
00975 bool EMU_DCDCOutputVoltageSet(uint32_t mV)
00976 {
00977 #if defined( _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_3V0LNATT1_MASK )
00978   bool validOutVoltage;
00979   uint32_t pwrCfg;
00980   bool lnMode;
00981   bool attSet;
00982   uint32_t attMask;
00983   uint32_t vrefLow;
00984   uint32_t vrefHigh;
00985   uint32_t vrefVal;
00986   uint32_t mVlow;
00987   uint32_t mVhigh;
00988   uint32_t vrefShift;
00989   uint32_t lpcmpBias;
00990   uint32_t lpcmpHystSel;
00991   volatile uint32_t* ctrlReg;
00992 
00993   /* Get current power configuration and assert on invalid use-cases. */
00994   pwrCfg = (EMU->PWRCFG & _EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_MASK);
00995   validOutVoltage = (pwrCfg == EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_DCDCTODVDD)
00996                     || (pwrCfg == EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_DCDCTODECOUPLE)
00997 #if defined( _EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_SOFTWARE )
00998                     || (pwrCfg == EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_SOFTWARE)
00999 #endif
01000                     ;
01001 
01002   if (!validOutVoltage)
01003   {
01004     return false;
01005   }
01006 
01007   /* Check that the set voltage is within valid range (TBD) */
01008   validOutVoltage = false;
01009   if ((pwrCfg == EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_DCDCTODVDD)
01010 #if defined( _EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_SOFTWARE )
01011       || (pwrCfg == EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_SOFTWARE)
01012 #endif
01013       )
01014   {
01015     validOutVoltage = ((mV >= 1200) && (mV <= 3000));
01016   }
01017   else if (pwrCfg == EMU_PWRCFG_PWRCFG_DCDCTODECOUPLE)
01018   {
01019     validOutVoltage = ((mV >= 900) && (mV <= 1320));
01020   }
01021 
01022   if (!validOutVoltage)
01023   {
01024     return false;
01025   }
01026 
01027   /* Get LP/LN mode, set control reg pointer and VREF shift. */
01028   lnMode    = (EMU->DCDCCTRL & _EMU_DCDCCTRL_DCDCMODE_MASK)
01029               == EMU_DCDCCTRL_DCDCMODE_LOWNOISE;
01030   ctrlReg   = (lnMode ? &EMU->DCDCLNVCTRL : &EMU->DCDCLPVCTRL);
01031   vrefShift = (lnMode ? _EMU_DCDCLNVCTRL_LNVREF_SHIFT
01032                       : _EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL_LPVREF_SHIFT);
01033 
01034   /* Set attenuation to use */
01035   attSet = (mV > 1800);
01036   if (attSet)
01037   {
01038     mVlow = 1800;
01039     mVhigh = 3000;
01040     attMask = (lnMode ? EMU_DCDCLNVCTRL_LNATT : EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL_LPATT);
01041   }
01042   else
01043   {
01044     mVlow = 1200;
01045     mVhigh = 1800;
01046     attMask = 0;
01047   }
01048 
01049   /* Get 2-point calib data from DEVINFO, calculate trimming and set voltege */
01050   if (lnMode)
01051   {
01052     /* Set low-noise DCDC output */
01053     if (attSet)
01054     {
01055       vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLNVCTRL0;
01056       vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_3V0LNATT1_MASK)
01057                  >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_3V0LNATT1_SHIFT;
01058       vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_1V8LNATT1_MASK)
01059                  >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_1V8LNATT1_SHIFT;
01060     }
01061     else
01062     {
01063       vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLNVCTRL0;
01064       vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_1V8LNATT0_MASK)
01065                  >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_1V8LNATT0_SHIFT;
01066       vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_1V2LNATT0_MASK)
01067                  >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLNVCTRL0_1V2LNATT0_SHIFT;
01068     }
01069   }
01070   else
01071   {
01072     /* Set low-power DCDC output */
01073 
01074     /* Get LPCMPBIAS and make sure masks are not overlayed */
01075     lpcmpBias = EMU->DCDCMISCCTRL & _EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_MASK;
01076     EFM_ASSERT(!(_EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_MASK & attMask));
01077     switch (attMask | lpcmpBias)
01078     {
01079       case EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL_LPATT | EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_BIAS0:
01080         vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL2;
01081         vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL2_3V0LPATT1LPCMPBIAS0_MASK)
01082                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL2_3V0LPATT1LPCMPBIAS0_SHIFT;
01083         vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL2_1V8LPATT1LPCMPBIAS0_MASK)
01084                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL2_1V8LPATT1LPCMPBIAS0_SHIFT;
01085         break;
01086 
01087       case EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL_LPATT | EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_BIAS1:
01088         vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL2;
01089         vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL2_3V0LPATT1LPCMPBIAS1_MASK)
01090                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL2_3V0LPATT1LPCMPBIAS1_SHIFT;
01091         vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL2_1V8LPATT1LPCMPBIAS1_MASK)
01092                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL2_1V8LPATT1LPCMPBIAS1_SHIFT;
01093         break;
01094 
01095       case EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL_LPATT | EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_BIAS2:
01096         vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL3;
01097         vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL3_3V0LPATT1LPCMPBIAS2_MASK)
01098                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL3_3V0LPATT1LPCMPBIAS2_SHIFT;
01099         vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL3_1V8LPATT1LPCMPBIAS2_MASK)
01100                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL3_1V8LPATT1LPCMPBIAS2_SHIFT;
01101         break;
01102 
01103       case EMU_DCDCLPVCTRL_LPATT | EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_BIAS3:
01104         vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL3;
01105         vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL3_3V0LPATT1LPCMPBIAS3_MASK)
01106                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL3_3V0LPATT1LPCMPBIAS3_SHIFT;
01107         vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL3_1V8LPATT1LPCMPBIAS3_MASK)
01108                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL3_1V8LPATT1LPCMPBIAS3_SHIFT;
01109         break;
01110 
01111       case EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_BIAS0:
01112         vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL0;
01113         vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL0_1V8LPATT0LPCMPBIAS0_MASK)
01114                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL0_1V8LPATT0LPCMPBIAS0_SHIFT;
01115         vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL0_1V2LPATT0LPCMPBIAS0_MASK)
01116                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL0_1V2LPATT0LPCMPBIAS0_SHIFT;
01117         break;
01118 
01119       case EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_BIAS1:
01120         vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL0;
01121         vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL0_1V8LPATT0LPCMPBIAS1_MASK)
01122                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL0_1V8LPATT0LPCMPBIAS1_SHIFT;
01123         vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL0_1V2LPATT0LPCMPBIAS1_MASK)
01124                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL0_1V2LPATT0LPCMPBIAS1_SHIFT;
01125         break;
01126 
01127       case EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_BIAS2:
01128         vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL1;
01129         vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL1_1V8LPATT0LPCMPBIAS2_MASK)
01130                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL1_1V8LPATT0LPCMPBIAS2_SHIFT;
01131         vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL1_1V2LPATT0LPCMPBIAS2_MASK)
01132                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL1_1V2LPATT0LPCMPBIAS2_SHIFT;
01133         break;
01134 
01135       case EMU_DCDCMISCCTRL_LPCMPBIAS_BIAS3:
01136         vrefLow  = DEVINFO->DCDCLPVCTRL1;
01137         vrefHigh = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL1_1V8LPATT0LPCMPBIAS3_MASK)
01138                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL1_1V8LPATT0LPCMPBIAS3_SHIFT;
01139         vrefLow  = (vrefLow & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL1_1V2LPATT0LPCMPBIAS3_MASK)
01140                    >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPVCTRL1_1V2LPATT0LPCMPBIAS3_SHIFT;
01141         break;
01142 
01143       default:
01144         EFM_ASSERT(false);
01145         break;
01146     }
01147 
01148     /* Set low-power comparator hysteresis level */
01149 #if defined( _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSTEL0_MASK )
01150     lpcmpHystSel = DEVINFO->DCDCLPCMPHYSTEL0;
01151 #elif defined( _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSSEL0_MASK )
01152     lpcmpHystSel = DEVINFO->DCDCLPCMPHYSSEL0;
01153 #endif
01154     if (attSet)
01155     {
01156 #if defined( _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSTEL0_MASK )
01157       lpcmpHystSel = (lpcmpHystSel & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSTEL0_LPCMPHYSTELLPATT1_MASK)
01158                       >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSTEL0_LPCMPHYSTELLPATT1_SHIFT;
01159 #elif defined( _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSSEL0_MASK )
01160       lpcmpHystSel = (lpcmpHystSel & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSSEL0_LPCMPHYSSELLPATT1_MASK)
01161                       >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSSEL0_LPCMPHYSSELLPATT1_SHIFT;
01162 #endif
01163     }
01164     else
01165     {
01166 #if defined( _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSTEL0_MASK )
01167       lpcmpHystSel = (lpcmpHystSel & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSTEL0_LPCMPHYSTELLPATT0_MASK)
01168                       >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSTEL0_LPCMPHYSTELLPATT0_SHIFT;
01169 #elif defined( _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSSEL0_MASK )
01170       lpcmpHystSel = (lpcmpHystSel & _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSSEL0_LPCMPHYSSELLPATT0_MASK)
01171                       >> _DEVINFO_DCDCLPCMPHYSSEL0_LPCMPHYSSELLPATT0_SHIFT;
01172 #endif
01173     }
01174     lpcmpHystSel <<= _EMU_DCDCLPCTRL_LPCMPHYSSEL_SHIFT;
01175     BUS_RegMaskedWrite(&EMU->DCDCLPCTRL, _EMU_DCDCLPCTRL_LPCMPHYSSEL_MASK, lpcmpHystSel);
01176   }
01177 
01178   /* Check for valid 2-point trim values */
01179   if ((vrefLow == 0xFF) && (vrefHigh == 0xFF))
01180   {
01181     return false;
01182   }
01183 
01184   /* Calculate and set voltage trim */
01185   vrefVal = ((mV - mVlow) * (vrefHigh - vrefLow))  / (mVhigh - mVlow);
01186   vrefVal += vrefLow;
01187 
01188   /* Range check */
01189   if ((vrefVal > vrefHigh) || (vrefVal < vrefLow))
01190   {
01191     return false;
01192   }
01193 
01194   *ctrlReg = (vrefVal << vrefShift) | attMask;
01195 #endif
01196   return true;
01197 }
01198 #endif
01199 
01200 
01203 #endif /* __EM_EMU_H */
